alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 5:43PM CDT until June 07 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern De Kalb County in middle Tennessee... Southeastern Jackson County in middle Tennessee... Putnam County in middle Tennessee... Southern Smith County in middle Tennessee... North Central White County in middle Tennessee... Southeastern Wilson County in middle Tennessee... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 543 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heavier storms. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cookeville, Algood, Watertown, Baxter, Gordonsville, Hickman, Alexandria, Edgar Evans State Park, Center Hill Lake, Burgess Falls State Park, Cummins Falls State Park and Hamptons Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Jackson; Putnam; Smith; White; Wilson
